result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Ray Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with all Child Support and/or Family Court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Stay out of taverns, bars, and liquor stores.  Pay child support and comply with family court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.  Defendant Donald Ray Ward in court with attorney Kaitlin A Lamb.  Defendant Donald Ray Ward in custody.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion on postconviction relief hearing.

Per Atty Lamb:  State breached plea agreement.
State admits to breach.
BTC:  If breached, least restrictive judgment should be ordered.  Sentence vacated, but to remain in effect until new sentencing by a new judge.

Per Atty Lamb,complaint insufficient 
Per Atty Schwab, drugs found in backpack of co-defendant along with baby items.
Per Atty Lamb, drugs were in someone else's possession, insufficient facts.
BTC:  Court satisfied that complaint contains sufficient facts to substantiate a probable cause hearing (not deficient).
Argument for IAC - only 1 count substantiated
Per Atty Schwab, no multiplicity
Per Atty Lamb, continuous offense
BTC:  No multiciplicity, each day is a seperate offense.

Regarding IA claim:
Atty Lamb calls Lori Kuehn - DSAT - defendant's former counsel.
Defendant waives his attorney/client priviledge.
Cross by Atty Schwab.  
Questionned by the court.  

Atty Lamb calls Donald Ward - DSAT- he was unaware of any challenges to the complaint
Cross by Atty Schwab 

Argument by Atty Lamb.
Argument by Atty Schwab.

BTC:  Defense failed to meet the burden for ineffective assistance of counsel.  No basis to withdraw plea.  However, as defendant didn't receive the benefit of the plea agreement, he is entitled to new sentencing before a different judge regarding the 4 counts he plead to.  Judgment of Conviction to remain in full force and effect until resentencing.    Atty Lamb to prepare the order from today.   

Atty Lamb indicated that she will notify the court that a different attorney will represent the defendant at the next sentencing.

Sentencing hearing on November 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Donald Ray Ward in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Donald Ray Ward in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Matter is set for day one of trial.  State has extended an offer that defendant will accept.
Offer:  Plea to Cts. 1,4,6&12.  Rec 8 yrs WPS/6 years init/2 years es on Ct. 1; 4years WPS/2 years init/2 years es, consec on Ct. 4; I/S probation on Cts. 6&12.
Plea:  Cts. 1,4,6,12 - G.
BTC:  Cts. 1,4,6,12 - GUILTY.  Cts. 2,3,5,7,8,9,10,11,13,14,15 - DRI.  PSI ordered.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Second Amended Information

Defendant Donald Ray Ward in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Donald Ray Ward in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State files a second amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt, defense objects to cts 8, 11, & 13. BTC: objection is summarily denied. The Court will accept the second amended information. The offer was withdrawn when the deft requested a trial. The jury coordinator provides the Court with juror notes which are marked as Court's Exhibit #1
Parties have entered into a stipulation regarding the chain of custody and the finding of the chemist/certification reports from crime lab analyst. State's document, making the counts clearer, may be marked as an exhibit and given to the jury prior to testimony and deliberations. The State moves to strike juror #141 stricken as she is being prosecuted by Ms. Riek and there is a trial scheduled. Juror #141 is stricken.
Jury enters courtroom, Oath #1 given. Court welcomes jury. Parties introduce self and persons in their respective offices as well as prospective witnesses. Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by Ms. Riek for the State. Voir Dire by Ms, Kuehn. Parties exercise their peremptory challenges. The jury is chosen. Parties agree on the jury as chosen.
